question: A person with which blood group will be a universal donor?
explanation: Individuals with type O Rh D negative blood are often called universal donors. This lack of antigens means that type O negative blood can be transfused in people of any blood type; hence, the term universal blood donor. Individuals with the blood group O Rh negative are called “universal donors” because their red blood cells can be transfused to people of all blood groups.
